events.title: Soviet Union Declares War on Japan
events.description: The Soviet Union declared war on Japan, launching a massive invasion of Japanese-held territories in Manchuria during World War II.
events.significance: This action was significant as it hastened the Japanese surrender and the end of World War II in the Pacific.

events.title: Buddhist Monk Thích Quảng Đức Self-Immolation
events.description: Thích Quảng Đức, a Vietnamese Mahayana Buddhist monk, self-immolated at a busy Saigon intersection to protest the persecution of Buddhists by the South Vietnamese government.
events.significance: The event drew global attention to religious oppression in Vietnam and intensified opposition to the regime.

events.title: Battle of Kunersdorf
events.description: During the Seven Years' War, a coalition of Russian and Austrian forces decisively defeated the Prussian army led by Frederick the Great at Kunersdorf, Prussia (now Poland).
events.significance: The defeat was one of Frederick the Great's worst and nearly ended Prussia's role as a major European power.

events.title: Apollo 11 Astronauts Quarantine Begins
events.description: Apollo 11 astronauts Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin, and Michael Collins began a 21-day quarantine to prevent any potential contamination from lunar pathogens after their historic moon landing.
events.significance: This was a crucial public health measure reflecting the new challenges of space exploration.

events.title: Resignation Announcement of U.S. President Richard Nixon
events.description: Richard Nixon announced his resignation from the presidency amid the Watergate scandal, effective August 9.
events.significance: His resignation marked the first and only resignation of a U.S. president and had lasting implications for American politics and trust in government.
